intro: Casearia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf casearia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Salicaceae family, which includes willows and poplars, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are typically followed by distinctive, woody capsules containing seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
